topic.title: Summary of SHI Block to Ethernet Connectivity Rules

body.p: The following is a summary of the Ethernet client SERDES to Ethernet subsystem connectivity rules.

li.p: Rule: an Ethernet client can connect to any SERDES bank when using the NMS managed method for assigning Ethernet PHY channels to Ethernet clients. Ethernet clients must connect to the same SERDES bank when the SDK is used to assign Ethernet PHY channels to Ethernet clients.

Rule: SERDES lanes for 400GAUI-16, 400GAUI-8, 200GAUI-8, 200GAUI-4, CAUI-4, or 100GAUI-2 MLDs must be source from the same SERDES bank. Lanes for an Ethernet MLD cannot be sourced from a mix of SERDES banks.
Rule: PAM4 and NRZ SHI block grouping rules apply to Ethernet single SERDES lane PHYs and MLDs.

Rule: SERDES used for all Ethernet MLDs (400GAUI-16, 400GAUI-8, 200GAUI-8, 200GAUI-4, CAUI-4, or 100GAUI-2) must be adjacent. SERDES from the MLDs must connect to adjacent SHI blocks (NRZ) and adjacent SHI block sub-groups (PAM4).

Rule: SERDES used for 400GE GAUI-16, 400GE GAUI-8, 200GAUI-8, 200GE GAUI-4, and 100GE CAUI-4 must be aligned on a SHI boundary. The first SERDES lane of the MLD must start at lane 0 of a SHI block. Additional restrictions apply when the SDK is used to automatically assign Ethernet PHY addresses as per the g5_api_enet_serdes_route_set() options.

body.p: The NRZ rule requires the four SERDES associated with a SHI block to be NRZ and connect to the same subsystem. Examples of the Ethernet subsystem application of the NRZ rule are as follows.

li.p: 4 x 10GE or 4 x 25GE will be sourced from the same SHI block.

The 16 lanes of a 400GE GAUI-16 are sourced from any adjacent selection of 4 x SHI blocks from the same SERDES bank, for example, SHI2, SHI3, SHI4 and SHI5 of bank C. The MLD uses consecutive SERDES starting at port 0 of SHI block 2. Connection of a 400GE GAUI-16 to SHI0, SHI2, SHI3, and SHI4 would not be supported as SERDES for the MLD would not be from adjacent SHI blocks.

The 8 lanes of a 200GE GAUI-8 are sourced from any adjacent selection of 2 x SHI blocks from the same SERDES bank, for example, SHI2 and SHI3 of bank C. The MLD uses consecutive SERDES starting at port 0 of SHI block 2. Connection of a 200GE GAUI-8 to SHI0 and SHI2 would not be supported as SERDES for the MLD would not be from adjacent SHI blocks.

body.p: The PAM4 rule requires the four SERDES of a SHI block to be PAM4 and PAM4 signals for a 2-lane MLD must be connected on adjacent SHI port boundaries of a SHI block as noted in SHI Block to Subsystem PAM4 and NRZ Connectivity Rules . A 100GE GAUI-2 must use quad SERDES subgroups for SHI ports 0-1 or 2-3. A 50GE GAUI will occupy one SHI subgroup (e.g. SHI port 0) the second SHI SERDES port (e.g. SHI port 1) may be blocked. For example, the second SHI SERDES port cannot be used for 10GE NRZ since NRZ and PAM cannot be mixed for a SHI Block and the second SHI SERDES port cannot be used as part of another Ethernet client MLD. However, the second SHI SERDES port could be used for a second 50GE GAUI. Note PAM4 SHI subgroups can be connected to different subsystems. For example, Interlaken, line OTN, or SYS OTN, but most typical applications do not require this scenario.
